scenes.description: You step into an old train station where the clocks have stopped but the air still remembers the sound of trains.

templates.happy: You feel a little thrill of adventure, as if you have discovered a secret place that belongs only to you for now.
templates.sad: The quiet emptiness matches your mood, but there is something gentle about the dust and sunlight that does not feel unfriendly.
templates.angry: The stillness gives your thoughts room to spread out and cool, the station offering no arguments, just silent space.
templates.disgust: There is dust and peeling paint, but the structure itself feels honest and solid, like it has nothing to hide.
templates.fear: The station is silent but not menacing; light filters through high windows, and you can clearly see every corner.
templates.surprised: You did not expect an empty place to feel this full of stories, as if people had just stepped out for a moment.
templates.neutral: You notice the details: old benches, faded posters, a timetable frozen on a long-gone afternoon.

scenes.description: Rows of empty seats face a dusty window, and an old bulletin board hangs crookedly on the wall.

templates.happy: You imagine the chatter and laughter that once filled this room and almost hear echoes of old conversations.
templates.sad: The quiet feels gentle rather than cold, as if the room is patiently waiting for someone to notice it again.
templates.angry: Your steps sound firm on the floor, and the room takes your presence without complaint, letting your energy settle.
templates.disgust: Some of the posters are torn and faded, yet the simple lines of the benches and the large window feel strangely satisfying.
templates.fear: Every corner of the room is clearly visible in the daylight, and nothing moves except a few drifting dust motes.
templates.surprised: You spot a small object left behind on a seat, a tiny reminder that someone once sat here with their own story.
templates.neutral: You scan the room, noticing the worn fabric on the seats and the soft creak of the old floorboards.

options.text: Pick up the small object left on the seat.
Leave the waiting room and go to the platform.

scenes.description: You step onto the platform, where weeds grow between the tracks and a single rusty sign sways slightly in the breeze.

templates.happy: The open sky and long lines of the tracks make you feel pleasantly small in a big, interesting world.
templates.sad: The quiet platform feels like a place where people once said goodbye and hello, and somehow that thought is comforting.
templates.angry: The solid rails and straight tracks give your mind something steady to rest on, a path that does not argue or change.
templates.disgust: The rust and weeds are honest signs of time passing; nothing here pretends to be perfect, and that feels oddly refreshing.
templates.fear: You can see far in both directions, and there is nowhere for anything to hide. The space feels open and honest.
templates.surprised: You are surprised by how peaceful the empty tracks seem without trains, like a story paused but not broken.
templates.neutral: You observe the long stretch of rails, the pattern of sleepers and the faint smell of metal and old oil.

options.text: Follow the tracks a short distance and then head home.
Go back inside to explore the waiting room.

scenes.description: In the waiting room, you find a small, worn ticket with a faded destination name.

templates.happy: The ticket feels like a tiny treasure, a secret link to someone else's journey that you now get to imagine.
templates.sad: You wonder who once held this ticket and whether they were nervous, hopeful or lonely, and somehow that makes you feel less alone.
templates.angry: You focus on the simple facts of the ticket, letting the clear print and straight edges pull your mind away from what upset you.
templates.disgust: The paper is worn but dry and harmless, more of a harmless relic than anything unpleasant.
templates.fear: The ticket is just paper, fragile and familiar. Nothing about it is threatening, only quietly mysterious.
templates.surprised: You are surprised that such a small, forgotten object can make the station feel suddenly full of possibilities.
templates.neutral: You examine the ticket, trying to read the faded destination and date.

options.text: Put the ticket in your pocket and step out to the platform.
Place the ticket carefully back on the seat and look around once more.

scenes.description: You walk along the tracks until the station is just a shape behind you.

templates.happy: You leave feeling like you have discovered a quiet secret, the kind that makes the world feel richer.
templates.sad: Your mood is still soft and low, but the calm of the station and the open sky sit with you like a gentle companion.
templates.angry: The steady rhythm of your steps beside the tracks helps your thoughts line up into something more manageable.
templates.disgust: The fresh air and open space help clear your head as you leave the worn station behind you.
templates.fear: Knowing that nothing frightening was waiting at the station makes the path ahead feel more trustworthy.
templates.surprised: You did not expect an abandoned place to feel so alive with quiet stories as you walk away.
templates.neutral: You simply note the sound of your footsteps and the fading silhouette of the old station.

scenes.description: You stand in the waiting room one last time, trying to imagine the day the station finally emptied.

templates.happy: You feel grateful for the small glimpse into another time, like you have visited a peaceful photograph.
templates.sad: The emptiness feels gentle now, like a pause instead of an ending, and you breathe a little easier.
templates.angry: Thinking about all the ordinary days that must have passed here helps your own problems feel less sharp.
templates.disgust: The room is old and imperfect, but also honest and calm, and that feels strangely refreshing.
templates.fear: You realize that this space is just a place, full of sunlight and dust, with nothing hiding in the corners.
templates.surprised: You are surprised by how attached you feel to a place you only just discovered.
templates.neutral: You take one last look around, committing the benches, the window and the crooked board to memory.
